answers.answer: My first appointment was at 15 weeks. It took forever for my insurance go through. But the average time for a first appt is 8-10 weeks
Yes my first official ultrasound with my doctor was 9 weeks 3 days.

i see okay so i have a wee while to wait. i guess i can get info from the internet. the biggest worry i have is i have a history in my family of preeclampsia. so bad my mum had a stroke (scared) cant wait to discuss it with my MW. do u know a best time to tell work? i work as a nurse in intensive care worried about exposure to infectious people.
Oh gosh. That is a really tough one. I'd ask your doctor. My mother-in-law works in the ER so I'll ask her what her advice is on that :)

Then I would tell them asap. I had to tell my work the day I found out just for precautions. And yes defiantly tell them about the history of preeclampsia. They'll monitor your blood pressure more as you get further into your pregnancy
thanks girls. :) even just a phone call from my GP will put my mind at ease ur comments have certainly helped. xxxxx
Awe good! It's what we are here for! Any time! :)

question: hi everyone. i have just found out i'm preggers with my first baby after missing a period after theee week. (irregular anyway) cant get a midwife appoint for another 1/2 weeks. did anyone else have to wait that long. i'll go crazy with all the questions i have eeek.
title: first first first everything
